004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.controller;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.InterpolatingMatrixTreeMap;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.MatBuilder;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.MathUtil;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.Nat;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.StateSpaceUtil;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.Vector;
014import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d;
015import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N1;
016import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N2;
017import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N5;
018import edu.wpi.first.math.system.LinearSystem;
019import edu.wpi.first.math.trajectory.Trajectory;
020
021/**
022 * The linear time-varying differential drive controller has a similar form to the LQR, but the
023 * model used to compute the controller gain is the nonlinear model linearized around the
024 * drivetrain's current state. We precomputed gains for important places in our state-space, then
025 * interpolated between them with a LUT to save computational resources.
026 *
027 * <p>See section 8.7 in Controls Engineering in FRC for a derivation of the control law we used
028 * shown in theorem 8.7.4.
029 */
030public class LTVDifferentialDriveController {
031  private final double m_trackwidth;
032
033  // LUT from drivetrain linear velocity to LQR gain
034  private final InterpolatingMatrixTreeMap<Double, N2, N5> m_table =
035      new InterpolatingMatrixTreeMap<>();
036
037  private Matrix<N5, N1> m_error = new Matrix<>(Nat.N5(), Nat.N1());
038  private Matrix<N5, N1> m_tolerance = new Matrix<>(Nat.N5(), Nat.N1());
039
040  /** States of the drivetrain system. */
041  private enum State {
042    kX(0),
043    kY(1),
044    kHeading(2),
045    kLeftVelocity(3),
046    kRightVelocity(4);
047
048    public final int value;
049
050    State(int i) {
051      this.value = i;
052    }
053  }
054
055  /**
056   * Constructs a linear time-varying differential drive controller.
057   *
058   * @param plant The differential drive velocity plant.
059   * @param trackwidth The distance between the differential drive's left and right wheels in
060   *     meters.
061   * @param qelems The maximum desired error tolerance for each state.
062   * @param relems The maximum desired control effort for each input.
063   * @param dt Discretization timestep in seconds.
064   */
065  public LTVDifferentialDriveController(
066      LinearSystem<N2, N2, N2> plant,
067      double trackwidth,
068      Vector<N5> qelems,
069      Vector<N2> relems,
070      double dt) {
071    m_trackwidth = trackwidth;
072
073    // Control law derivation is in section 8.7 of
074    // https://file.tavsys.net/control/controls-engineering-in-frc.pdf
075    var A =
076        new MatBuilder<>(Nat.N5(), Nat.N5())
077            .fill(
078                0.0,
079                0.0,
080                0.0,
081                0.5,
082                0.5,
083                0.0,
084                0.0,
085                0.0,
086                0.0,
087                0.0,
088                0.0,
089                0.0,
090                0.0,
091                -1.0 / m_trackwidth,
092                1.0 / m_trackwidth,
093                0.0,
094                0.0,
095                0.0,
096                plant.getA(0, 0),
097                plant.getA(0, 1),
098                0.0,
099                0.0,
100                0.0,
101                plant.getA(1, 0),
102                plant.getA(1, 1));
103    var B =
104        new MatBuilder<>(Nat.N5(), Nat.N2())
105            .fill(
106                0.0,
107                0.0,
108                0.0,
109                0.0,
110                0.0,
111                0.0,
112                plant.getB(0, 0),
113                plant.getB(0, 1),
114                plant.getB(1, 0),
115                plant.getB(1, 1));
116    var Q = StateSpaceUtil.makeCostMatrix(qelems);
117    var R = StateSpaceUtil.makeCostMatrix(relems);
118
119    // dx/dt = Ax + Bu
120    // 0 = Ax + Bu
121    // Ax = -Bu
122    // x = -A⁻¹Bu
123    double maxV =
124        plant
125            .getA()
126            .solve(plant.getB().times(new MatBuilder<>(Nat.N2(), Nat.N1()).fill(12.0, 12.0)))
127            .times(-1.0)
128            .get(0, 0);
129
130    for (double velocity = -maxV; velocity < maxV; velocity += 0.01) {
131      // The DARE is ill-conditioned if the velocity is close to zero, so don't
132      // let the system stop.
133      if (Math.abs(velocity) < 1e-4) {
134        m_table.put(velocity, new Matrix<>(Nat.N2(), Nat.N5()));
135      } else {
136        A.set(State.kY.value, State.kHeading.value, velocity);
137        m_table.put(velocity, new LinearQuadraticRegulator<N5, N2, N5>(A, B, Q, R, dt).getK());
138      }
139    }
140  }
141
142  /**
143   * Returns true if the pose error is within tolerance of the reference.
144   *
145   * @return True if the pose error is within tolerance of the reference.
146   */
147  public boolean atReference() {
148    return Math.abs(m_error.get(0, 0)) < m_tolerance.get(0, 0)
149        && Math.abs(m_error.get(1, 0)) < m_tolerance.get(1, 0)
150        && Math.abs(m_error.get(2, 0)) < m_tolerance.get(2, 0)
151        && Math.abs(m_error.get(3, 0)) < m_tolerance.get(3, 0)
152        && Math.abs(m_error.get(4, 0)) < m_tolerance.get(4, 0);
153  }
154
155  /**
156   * Sets the pose error which is considered tolerable for use with atReference().
157   *
158   * @param poseTolerance Pose error which is tolerable.
159   * @param leftVelocityTolerance Left velocity error which is tolerable in meters per second.
160   * @param rightVelocityTolerance Right velocity error which is tolerable in meters per second.
161   */
162  public void setTolerance(
163      Pose2d poseTolerance, double leftVelocityTolerance, double rightVelocityTolerance) {
164    m_tolerance =
165        new MatBuilder<>(Nat.N5(), Nat.N1())
166            .fill(
167                poseTolerance.getX(),
168                poseTolerance.getY(),
169                poseTolerance.getRotation().getRadians(),
170                leftVelocityTolerance,
171                rightVelocityTolerance);
172  }
173
174  /**
175   * Returns the left and right output voltages of the LTV controller.
176   *
177   * <p>The reference pose, linear velocity, and angular velocity should come from a drivetrain
178   * trajectory.
179   *
180   * @param currentPose The current pose.
181   * @param leftVelocity The current left velocity in meters per second.
182   * @param rightVelocity The current right velocity in meters per second.
183   * @param poseRef The desired pose.
184   * @param leftVelocityRef The desired left velocity in meters per second.
185   * @param rightVelocityRef The desired right velocity in meters per second.
186   * @return Left and right output voltages of the LTV controller.
187   */
188  public DifferentialDriveWheelVoltages calculate(
189      Pose2d currentPose,
190      double leftVelocity,
191      double rightVelocity,
192      Pose2d poseRef,
193      double leftVelocityRef,
194      double rightVelocityRef) {
195    // This implements the linear time-varying differential drive controller in
196    // theorem 9.6.3 of https://tavsys.net/controls-in-frc.
197    var x =
198        new MatBuilder<>(Nat.N5(), Nat.N1())
199            .fill(
200                currentPose.getX(),
201                currentPose.getY(),
202                currentPose.getRotation().getRadians(),
203                leftVelocity,
204                rightVelocity);
205
206    var inRobotFrame = Matrix.eye(Nat.N5());
207    inRobotFrame.set(0, 0, Math.cos(x.get(State.kHeading.value, 0)));
208    inRobotFrame.set(0, 1, Math.sin(x.get(State.kHeading.value, 0)));
209    inRobotFrame.set(1, 0, -Math.sin(x.get(State.kHeading.value, 0)));
210    inRobotFrame.set(1, 1, Math.cos(x.get(State.kHeading.value, 0)));
211
212    var r =
213        new MatBuilder<>(Nat.N5(), Nat.N1())
214            .fill(
215                poseRef.getX(),
216                poseRef.getY(),
217                poseRef.getRotation().getRadians(),
218                leftVelocityRef,
219                rightVelocityRef);
220    m_error = r.minus(x);
221    m_error.set(
222        State.kHeading.value, 0, MathUtil.angleModulus(m_error.get(State.kHeading.value, 0)));
223
224    double velocity = (leftVelocity + rightVelocity) / 2.0;
225    var K = m_table.get(velocity);
226
227    var u = K.times(inRobotFrame).times(m_error);
228
229    return new DifferentialDriveWheelVoltages(u.get(0, 0), u.get(1, 0));
230  }
231
232  /**
233   * Returns the left and right output voltages of the LTV controller.
234   *
235   * <p>The reference pose, linear velocity, and angular velocity should come from a drivetrain
236   * trajectory.
237   *
238   * @param currentPose The current pose.
239   * @param leftVelocity The left velocity in meters per second.
240   * @param rightVelocity The right velocity in meters per second.
241   * @param desiredState The desired pose, linear velocity, and angular velocity from a trajectory.
242   * @return The left and right output voltages of the LTV controller.
243   */
244  public DifferentialDriveWheelVoltages calculate(
245      Pose2d currentPose,
246      double leftVelocity,
247      double rightVelocity,
248      Trajectory.State desiredState) {
249    // v = (v_r + v_l) / 2     (1)
250    // w = (v_r - v_l) / (2r)  (2)
251    // k = w / v               (3)
252    //
253    // v_l = v - wr
254    // v_l = v - (vk)r
255    // v_l = v(1 - kr)
256    //
257    // v_r = v + wr
258    // v_r = v + (vk)r
259    // v_r = v(1 + kr)
260    return calculate(
261        currentPose,
262        leftVelocity,
263        rightVelocity,
264        desiredState.poseMeters,
265        desiredState.velocityMetersPerSecond
266            * (1 - (desiredState.curvatureRadPerMeter * m_trackwidth / 2.0)),
267        desiredState.velocityMetersPerSecond
268            * (1 + (desiredState.curvatureRadPerMeter * m_trackwidth / 2.0)));
269  }
270}
